title: Art Deco era?
content:
Hi All

Anyone have any ideas what this beauty could be? Any help appreciated

thanks in advance

Tom

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/samp_4898.jpg)

 [‹ K-Y Intrigue](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/typophile.com/node/41220 "Go to previous forum topic") [what is this typeface? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/typophile.com/node/41206 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tomdarra

comments.content:
How old is this sample? Possibly hand drawn.  
Alternatives:  
 [P22 Arts and Crafts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/p22/p22_arts_and_crafts_family/)  
 [Maigret](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/maigret/)  
 [Quaint Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/?refby=typographica)  
 [Amity](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sentinel/amity/?refby=typographica)  
 [ITC Stoclet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181300/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/itc_stoclet/)

Thanks for those alternatives Stephen.

I have no idea of the date unfortunately, I have a folder on my computer of snippets of type samples I like and I just re-discovered this jpg. Could well be hand drawn.
